metadata.titleEn: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network (automatic weather station of desert station, 2023)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（荒漠站自动气象站-2023）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the desert station from January 1 to December 31, 2023. The site (100.9872°E, 42.1135°N) was located on a desert surface in the desert, which is near Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 1054 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45AC; 5 and 10 m, north), wind speed profile (010C; 5 and 10 m, north), wind direction (020C, 10m), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 10 m), four-component radiometer (CNR1; 6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (109ss-L; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0 m), soil moisture profile (ML3; -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m and Ta_10 m; RH_5 m and RH_10 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_5 m and Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_100 cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_100 cm) (%).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2023-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) and Liu et al. (2023).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2023年1月1日至2023年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游荒漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗荒漠滩，下垫面是红砂荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.9872E, 42.1135N，海拔1054m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m处，风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2023-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)和Liu et al. (2023)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are long-term observations necessary for understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Verification.QuestionCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换是否必要？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Does data collection in oasis–desert ecosystems primarily rely on eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, or automatic weather stations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集主要依赖于涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪还是自动气象站？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, automatic weather stations
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are the challenges in maintaining oasis–desert systems more related to the degradation of natural vegetation, the drying up of water bodies, or the intensification of land desertification?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 维护绿洲-沙漠系统的挑战更多与自然植被的退化、水体的干涸还是土地沙漠化的加剧有关？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: degradation of natural vegetation, drying up of water bodies, intensification of land desertification
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 自然植被退化、水体干涸、土地荒漠化加剧

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method for monitoring air temperature and humidity in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个在干旱地区监测空气温度和湿度的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: An example is using sensors placed at different heights (5m and 10m) to measure air temperature and relative humidity, with the sensors oriented towards the north to ensure consistent data collection.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个例子是使用放置在不同高度（5米和10米）的传感器来测量空气温度和相对湿度，传感器朝向北方以确保数据收集的一致性。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a dataset that includes both meteorological and soil data in an oasis–desert ecosystem?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个包含绿洲-沙漠生态系统中气象和土壤数据的数据集的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example dataset includes meteorological observations such as air temperature, humidity, wind speed and direction, and soil data like soil temperature and moisture profiles in the oasis–desert ecosystem, collected over a specified period like 2023.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个示例数据集包括气象观测，如空气温度、湿度、风速和风向，以及土壤数据，如土壤温度和湿度剖面，这些数据是在2023年期间收集的，涉及绿洲-沙漠生态系统。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of data collection methods used in arid and semiarid regions for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区用于能量、水汽和碳交换观测的数据收集方法的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term measurements, energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, methane fluxes, auxiliary hydrometeorological data, vegetation parameters, soil parameters, eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, automatic weather stations, specified intervals, half-hourly averages, 10-minute averages
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期测量、能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、甲烷通量、辅助水文气象数据、植被参数、土壤参数、涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站、指定间隔、半小时平均、10分钟平均。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific features are considered crucial when designing observational datasets for oasis–desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在设计绿洲-沙漠生态系统的观察性数据集时，哪些具体特征被认为是至关重要的？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: energy exchange, water vapor exchange, carbon exchange, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature, gradients of humidity, wind speed, wind direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, groundwater table data, vegetation parameters, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 能量交换、水汽交换、碳交换、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度梯度、湿度梯度、风速、风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面、地下水位数据、植被参数、土壤参数

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with the collection and quality control of data in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域，数据收集和质量控制面临哪些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: ecological environment degradation, river and lake drying, natural vegetation degradation, intensified land desertification, frequent dust storms, data completeness, duplicate records, data outside physical or instrumental limits, questionable data entries
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 生态环境退化，河流和湖泊干涸，自然植被退化，土地沙漠化加剧，频繁的沙尘暴，数据完整性，重复记录，超出物理或仪器限制的数据，可疑的数据条目

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations are established in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，HRB中下游地区建立了多少个陆面通量和气象站？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of data collection for hydrometeorological parameters in the observational datasets from oasis–desert systems?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集中，水文气象参数的数据收集频率是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the role of an automatic weather station in data collection for meteorological research in arid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 自动气象站在干旱地区气象研究中的数据收集角色是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: An automatic weather station collects hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. These observations are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions, with data typically averaged over a 10-minute period.
Definition.AnswerCn: 自动气象站收集水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面。这些观测对于理解干旱地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要，数据通常以10分钟为周期进行平均。

Definition.QuestionEn: What constitutes the primary challenges of data collection in inland river basins within arid and semiarid areas?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，内陆河流流域数据收集的主要挑战是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The primary challenges include ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrences of dust storms. These issues are especially prevalent in inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Definition.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁发生的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路向西的内陆河流流域尤为突出，如塔里木河流域、咸海流域和乌尔米湖流域。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is quality control typically enforced in the collection of meteorological data in arid environments?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱环境中，气象数据的收集通常是如何实施质量控制的？
Definition.AnswerEn: Quality control involves ensuring data completeness by marking any missing data, removing duplicate records, and discarding data that exceed the physical meaning or instrument range. Suspicious data are highlighted, and date and time formats are standardized to maintain consistency and accuracy in the dataset.
Definition.AnswerCn: 质量控制涉及通过标记任何缺失数据、删除重复记录以及丢弃超出物理意义或仪器范围的数据来确保数据的完整性。可疑数据会被突出显示，日期和时间格式会被标准化，以保持数据集的一致性和准确性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the scope of datasets from oasis–desert systems differ from those in other arid regions regarding hydrometeorological parameters?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集在水文气象参数方面与其他干旱地区的数据集的范围有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets from oasis–desert systems tend to include a broader range of hydrometeorological parameters, such as energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, alongside vegetation and soil parameters. In contrast, other arid region datasets might focus more narrowly on basic meteorological data and soil moisture profiles.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集往往包括更广泛的水文气象参数，如能量、水蒸气和碳通量，以及植被和土壤参数。相比之下，其他干旱地区的数据集可能更侧重于基本气象数据和土壤湿度剖面。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the long-term changes in energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems based on the observed data patterns over the years?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 根据多年来观察到的数据模式，可以推断出绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的长期变化是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: It can be inferred that understanding these long-term data patterns is crucial to maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems, which is significant for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, as well as supporting ecological security and sustainable development in oasis–desert areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 可以推断，理解这些长期数据模式对于维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，这对实现碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲-沙漠地区的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the degradation of ecological environments in inland river basins within arid and semiarid areas, affecting data collection for oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，内陆河流域生态环境退化的因素有哪些，这些因素又如何影响对绿洲-沙漠系统的数据收集？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological environment degradation due to the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in regions like the Tarim River basin and the Aral Sea basin.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化，主要表现为河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，特别是在塔里木河流域和咸海流域等地区。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems for sustainable development and data collection efforts?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么了解绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换对于可持续发展和数据收集工作至关重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Understanding these exchanges is crucial for achieving carbon peaking and neutrality goals, maintaining ecological stability, and supporting socioeconomic development in oasis–desert areas, which are essential for sustainable oasis development.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 理解这些交换对于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标、维持生态稳定以及支持绿洲-沙漠地区的社会经济发展至关重要，这对可持续的绿洲发展是必不可少的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What challenges arise in maintaining long-term observational data collection in oasis–desert ecosystems, and how do they impact data quality and availability?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，维持长期观测数据收集面临哪些挑战，这些挑战如何影响数据质量和可用性？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological degradation, which affects the stability of observation systems, and the need for consistent long-term data to understand oasis–desert interactions, crucial for protecting ecological stability and supporting sustainable development.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态退化，这影响了观测系统的稳定性，以及需要一致的长期数据来理解绿洲与沙漠的相互作用，这对保护生态稳定性和支持可持续发展至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of utilizing automated weather stations with 10-minute average periods for data collection in arid and semi-arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，使用10分钟平均周期的数据收集的自动气象站可能带来的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing automated weather stations with 10-minute average periods can provide a detailed temporal resolution of hydrometeorological data, enabling a comprehensive understanding of short-term variations in energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid and semi-arid regions. This can enhance our ability to monitor and model the ecological dynamics of oasis–desert systems, contributing to sustainable development and ecological security.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用自动气象站进行10分钟平均周期的数据采集，可以提供详细的水文气象数据时间分辨率，从而深入理解干旱和半干旱地区能量、水蒸气和碳通量的短期变化。这可以增强我们监测和建模绿洲-沙漠系统生态动态的能力，有助于可持续发展和生态安全。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the integration of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data from multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations affect the understanding of oasis–desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多个陆面通量和气象站的能量、水汽和碳通量数据的整合将如何影响对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating data from multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations allows for a spatially comprehensive analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which is crucial for understanding oasis–desert interactions. This can lead to insights into ecological stability, resource management, and the socioeconomic development of oases, as well as contributing to the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合来自多个地表通量和气象站的数据，可以对能量、水汽和碳交换进行空间全面分析，这对于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这可以为生态稳定性、资源管理和绿洲的社会经济发展提供见解，同时也有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to collect long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集能量、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the intended objective of using automatic weather stations to gather hydrometeorological data in arid and semiarid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据的预期目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis by understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in these areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展，这对于实现这些地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of sustainable development?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在可持续发展背景下，为什么在绿洲和沙漠系统之间保持平衡是至关重要的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展目标、支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in ensuring the quality control of meteorological data collected from automatic weather stations in arid and semiarid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保在干旱和半干旱地区从自动气象站收集的气象数据质量控制的程序包括哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The quality control of meteorological data involves ensuring that there are 144 data points collected daily, marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data that exceeds physical or instrumental constraints, flagging data with uncertainty in red, and standardizing the format of date and time.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 气象数据的质量控制涉及确保每天收集144个数据点，用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，标记不确定的数据为红色，并标准化日期和时间的格式。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and technology are necessary to enable the continuous collection of hydrometeorological data in arid desert regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在干旱沙漠地区实现水文气象数据的连续收集需要哪些仪器和技术？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of automatic weather stations with sensors for air temperature, humidity, air pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction, radiation, and soil parameters, as well as eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, are necessary to enable continuous data collection in such environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用自动气象站配备空气温度、湿度、气压、降水、风速和风向、辐射以及土壤参数传感器，以及用于湍流通量数据的涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，是在此类环境中实现连续数据收集所必需的。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do quality control measures enable the integrity and reliability of meteorological datasets collected in remote desert locations?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 质量控制措施如何确保在偏远沙漠地区收集的气象数据集的完整性和可靠性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Quality control measures such as ensuring a consistent number of data points per day, marking missing or questionable data, and removing data that exceed physical or instrument limits, help maintain the integrity and reliability of the datasets collected in remote locations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 质量控制措施，如确保每天数据点数量一致、标记缺失或可疑数据，以及删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，有助于维护在偏远地区收集的数据集的完整性和可靠性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in maintaining data quality and consistency in long-term observational datasets in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在干旱地区维护长期观测数据集的数据质量和一致性可能会面临挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological environmental degradation, such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms, which can impact data consistency and quality.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴，这可能影响数据的一致性和质量。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What could be the anticipated difficulties in achieving accurate measurements of carbon and methane fluxes in oasis–desert areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区实现碳和甲烷通量的准确测量可能面临的预期困难是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Oasis–desert systems are complex and require understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics. These areas have been found to be carbon sinks, affecting the carbon balance and playing a role in the global carbon cycle, making accurate measurement challenging.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统是复杂的，需要理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换动态。这些地区被发现是碳汇，影响碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥作用，使得准确测量变得具有挑战性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of the data quality control measures applied in meteorological data collection in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在干旱地区气象数据收集中应用的数据质量控制措施的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The effectiveness of data quality control measures in meteorological data collection within arid regions can be considered robust, as they include ensuring daily data completeness, removing duplicates, handling outliers, and flagging questionable data. These steps help maintain data integrity and reliability, which are crucial for long-term observations and ecological studies in such challenging environments.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，气象数据收集中的数据质量控制措施的有效性可以被认为是稳健的，因为它们包括确保每日数据的完整性、去除重复数据、处理异常值以及标记可疑数据。这些步骤有助于维护数据的完整性和可靠性，这对于在这些具有挑战性的环境中进行长期观察和生态研究至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the challenges faced in collecting accurate hydrometeorological data in arid and semiarid inland river basins?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域收集准确的水文气象数据所面临的挑战的看法是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Collecting accurate hydrometeorological data in arid and semiarid inland river basins is challenging due to ecological degradation, such as drying rivers, vegetation loss, desertification, and dust storms. These conditions complicate data collection and require robust methodologies and quality control measures to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域，收集准确的水文气象数据面临挑战，这主要是由于生态退化，如河流干涸、植被丧失、沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些条件使数据收集变得复杂，需要强有力的方法和质量控制措施，以确保数据的准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets from oasis-desert systems contribute to understanding the ecological balance in these regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集如何有助于理解这些地区的生态平衡。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets from oasis-desert systems contribute to understanding the ecological balance by providing quantitative insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. These datasets help in recognizing interactions within the oasis-desert systems, supporting ecological stability, and guiding socioeconomic development by maintaining the balance necessary for sustainable oasis development.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集有助于理解生态平衡，通过提供对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量洞察。这些数据集有助于识别绿洲-沙漠系统内的相互作用，支持生态稳定，并通过维持可持续绿洲发展的必要平衡来指导社会经济发展。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the key data collection methods used for monitoring meteorological elements in arid and semi-arid regions, focusing on challenges and the precision of instruments employed.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述用于监测干旱和半干旱地区气象要素的关键数据收集方法，重点关注所面临的挑战和所使用仪器的精度。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in arid and semi-arid regions such as the 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网 include using automatic weather stations to monitor meteorological elements like air temperature, relative humidity, air pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction, and radiation. Instruments are positioned at various heights and orientations to ensure comprehensive data acquisition. Challenges include ensuring data quality and dealing with ecological degradation crises such as river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, and desertification.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，如黑河流域地表过程综合观测网，数据收集方法包括使用自动气象站监测气象要素，如气温、相对湿度、气压、降水、风速和风向以及辐射。仪器被放置在不同的高度和方向，以确保全面的数据采集。面临的挑战包括确保数据质量以及应对生态退化危机，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化和沙漠化。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the procedures for data processing and quality control applied to meteorological datasets, emphasizing methods to handle missing or erroneous data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述应用于气象数据集的数据处理和质量控制程序，强调处理缺失或错误数据的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedures involve ensuring each day has 144 data points (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data that are outside physical or instrument ranges, and marking questionable data in red. The format for date and time is standardized, and any discrepancies are addressed during processing. The procedures ensure that the datasets are reliable and minimize errors from the data collection process.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括确保每天有144个数据点（每10分钟一个），用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理或仪器范围的数据，并将可疑数据标记为红色。日期和时间的格式是标准化的，任何不一致之处在处理过程中都会得到解决。这些程序确保数据集的可靠性，并尽量减少数据收集过程中的错误。
